name: stage
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of an activity or a period of development

example.eg: The project is in its final stages and should be completed by August.
example.egtrans: 这个项目已进入最后阶段，应于8月份完成。

example.eg: They did the last stage of their journey on foot.
example.egtrans: 他们步行走完了旅途的最后一段路。

example.eg: Our marriage is going through a difficult stage at the moment.
example.egtrans: 目前我们的婚姻正处于一个困难阶段。

example.eg: Their youngest child is at the stage where she can say individual words but not full sentences.
example.egtrans: 他们最小的孩子目前所处的阶段是会说单个的词，但还不会说整句话。

example.eg: I'm not tired at the moment but I will need a rest at some stage (= at some time) during the walk.
example.egtrans: 我现在不累，但在步行过程中的某个时候需要休息一下。

example.eg: Andrew spends all his spare time playing with his computer but it's probably just a stage he's going through (= a period of development that will end soon).
example.egtrans: 安德鲁的业余时间全花在了玩电脑上，不过这可能只是一个阶段罢了。

trans_examp.trans_en: one of the separate parts of a rocket, each part having its own engine

example.eg: Once its fuel supply runs out, each stage separates from the main part of the rocket and falls back to earth.
example.egtrans: 每一级在燃料燃尽后，就会从火箭主体上脱落，落回到地球上。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: If you do something in stages, you divide the activity into parts and complete each part separately.

example.eg: We're decorating the house in stages so it won't be ready for another couple of months.
example.egtrans: 我们在逐步装修房子，所以还得几个月才能就绪。

dsense.name: stage
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the area in a theatre that is often raised above ground level and on which actors or entertainers perform

example.eg: Hamlet is on stage for most of the act.
example.egtrans: 这一幕的大部分时间哈姆雷特都出场。

example.eg: The orchestra went on/off stage to great applause.
example.egtrans: 管弦乐队在雷鸣般的掌声中登场／走下舞台。

example.eg: The play is a stage adaptation of William Golding's novel.
example.egtrans: 这部戏是根据威廉‧戈尔丁的小说改编的舞台剧。

example.eg: The singer returns to the Oslo stage (= will perform again in Oslo) this summer.
example.egtrans: 那位歌手今夏将重返奥斯陆舞台。

trans_examp.trans_en: a particular area of public life

example.eg: The president was extremely popular on the world stage but was disliked in his own country.
example.egtrans: 总统在世界舞台上极受欢迎，但在本国却不受拥戴。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to go onto the stage and start to perform

name: stage
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to arrange and perform a play or show

example.eg: The local drama group is staging a production of the musical "Grease".
example.egtrans: 当地剧团正在演出音乐剧《油脂》。

example.eg: London staged the Olympic Games in 2012.
example.egtrans: 伦敦于2012年举办了奥运会。
